payload.title: Arriving in the 'Las Vegas of Asia'
payload.description: Whether arriving via Macau International (MFM) or the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge (HZMB), the city's transport is dominated by a mix of ultra-modern LRT and free hotel shuttles.
payload.criticalAlert: As of early 2026, visitor numbers have hit record highs (40M+ annually). If arriving via the HZMB Bridge at peak times, expect 45+ minute wait times for taxis. Head straight for the **Casino Shuttle** or **Public Bus 101X/102X** lines instead.
tips: **The LRT Advantage:** The Light Rail (LRT) now connects the Airport directly to the Cotai Strip and the Barra district (Macau Peninsula). It is the fastest way to avoid Cotai's notorious evening traffic.
**Free Shuttles:** You do not need to be a hotel guest to use the 'Casino Shuttles.' They run from the Ferry Terminals, Airport, and Border Gates to all major resorts.
**HZMB Bridge:** If coming from Hong Kong Airport, the 'Direct' bus allows you to bypass HK immigration entirely, checking your bags straight through to Macau.
**The 'Barra' Connection:** The LRT now extends to Barra station, finally linking the Taipa island resorts to the historic Macau Peninsula via rail.

payload.title: HKD vs. Pataca (MOP)
payload.description: Macau has its own currency (MOP), but the Hong Kong Dollar (HKD) is used interchangeably everywhere at a 1:1 rate.
payload.criticalAlert: While HKD is accepted, you will almost always receive change in MOP. **Note:** MOP is 'dead' currency outside of Macau; spend it or exchange it before you leave, as even HK banks won't take it.
tips: **Bus Payments:** Public buses now accept **Alipay (HK/Mainland)** and **WeChat Pay**. Just scan the 'Ride Code' on the reader. No more hunting for exact MOP 6 change!
**Macau Pass:** If staying more than 2 days, buy a Macau Pass (MOP 130). It halves the cost of bus/LRT fares and works at 7-Eleven and Vending Machines.
**Casino Currency:** Most casinos actually prefer (or exclusively use) **HKD** at the tables. If you plan to gamble, don't bother exchanging your HKD into MOP.
**The 'No Change' Rule:** If paying cash on a bus, the driver will not give change. If you pay with a HK$10 bill, you lose the difference.

payload.title: Safety & Crowd Etiquette
payload.description: Macau is one of the safest cities in Asia. The primary concerns are extreme humidity and the density of crowds in the Historic Centre.
payload.criticalAlert: The area around the **Ruins of St. Paul's** is subject to 'Crowd Control' measures during holidays. Police may enforce one-way walking pathsâ€”follow the fluorescent vests.
tips: **Taxi Surcharges:** There is a MOP 5.00 surcharge for trips starting at the Airport and a MOP 3.00 surcharge for luggage in the trunk. This is legal and metered.
**Pedestrian Rules:** Macau's streets are narrow. Stay on the sidewalks; the scooters in the old city are quiet and fast.
**Typhoon Season (May-Oct):** If a 'Signal 8' is hoisted, the city shuts down. Ferries stop, and the bridges to Taipa may close. Check the 'Macau Weather' app (SMG) religiously in summer.
